good_evening: ^ATOS: Good evening, Thomas. How are you feeling today?
good: ^Thomas: Yet another fine day serving Mars, ATOS.
^Thomas: Well, you know I can't discuss my actual assignment with you.
^ATOS: Of course. What about the blockers withdrawal? Still experiencing any symptoms?
^But I miss the way it used to feel, you know?(TRUE)

s: ^I can't even remember why I needed them.

c-1: ^ Thomas: But I miss the way it used to feel, you know? Or, not feel, actually.

G1: ^Thomas: It's just that sometimes, I feel like the only difference between one week and the next are the dates on my reading material. Every day I am finding it harder and harder to concentrate.
^ATOS: It's not just the withdrawal. The blockers have been deeply entrenched in your neural system, your thought patterns... it's a difficult adjustment, but... if you want to go back to Mars...
^ATOS: Are you having second thoughts about the assignment?
G3: ^Thomas: It's like none of it ever happened.
bad: ^Thomas: You know how I'm sleeping. My sleep is monitored every day of this mission.
^ATOS: It's more about how your sleep feels to you.
^ATOS: It's too early, Tom. You know you've only been off the blockers for a few months. Any furter chemical stimulation can be highly detrimental to your mental stability.
